stories.title: The Hyperloop Will Never Work, and Here's Why

stories.text:
Is it known from inside the start-up world that there's a growing and general feeling of hostility from the general population throughout the world against what they do? Is there some awareness that Silicon Valley is perceived as a group of childish but dangerous villains?

What's your opinion? Are you a techbro? How do you reconcile the critique and mockery with what you do on a daily basis?
stories.title: Are techbros aware of the “techbro” stereotype?

stories.text:
Hey folks!

I track time for 4 years already...

Usually, remote work isn't demanding when for an engineer in a non-early stage startup. When you like your job and are excited about career growth, putting in extra hours can payout.

But for some folks working enough hours and doing something on the side could be a better strategy. When you think of time as an investment, you may distribute it properly between a day job, side projects, and hobbies.

How do you think of your time in the era of flexible work? Do you treat it as an investment, or do you go with a flow?

P.S. If you entertain an idea of allocating and tracking time, you may try it with https://increaser.org
stories.title: Remote Work and Free Time
